newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIAN BREWER DECIDES ON CARLSBERG, BBH OFFERS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIAN BREWER DECIDES ON CARLSBERG, BBH OFFERS.

text.p: Utenos Brewery said on Monday that shareholders will choose between investment offers from Danish Carlsberg and Baltic Beverage Holdings, owned by Finnish Hartwall and Norway's Orkla .
The group also confirmed a report in the Verslo Zinios business newspaper that Carlsberg offered to invest 81 million litas the firm, one of the leaders of Lithuania's beer market.
"Our shareholders will discuss the Carlsberg and BBH offers at a meeting today which starts at 1200," brewery general director Stasys Krasauskas told Reuters.
"The meeting may last up to four hours and at this stage it is impossible to say how the shareholders will choose as around 80 percent of shares are held by individual investors," he said.
BBH has offered 50 million litas in investments and said it would pay 300 litas per share, the newspaper report said.
Utenos has also been arguing with the state for several years over the size of the government's stake in the company.
Utenos says the state has 21.5 percent of the firm while the state says it may own as much as 35.6 percent.
